ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reported dizziness described as being off-balance with head movement; ENT evaluation confirmed symptoms consistent with left BPPV.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Otosclerosis (Post-Stapedectomy)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of bilateral stapedectomy and revision surgeries; audiogram reveals mixed hearing loss profile.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds given history of otosclerosis and surgeries.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Standard assessment of middle ear function, though often contraindicated or deferred in post-stapedectomy cases.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiologic evaluation revealed a complex mixed hearing loss profile consistent with the patient's history of bilateral stapedectomies. The right ear showed mild-to-severe mixed loss, while the left ear retained largely normal sensitivity in the low-to-mid frequencies before sloping to a mixed loss. Speech recognition was excellent bilaterally. Immittance testing was not performed due to the surgical history.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight sloping to mild mixed loss (250-1000 Hz), sloping to moderate-to-severe (2000-4000 Hz). Left ear: Slight SNHL (250-500 Hz), rising to normal (1000-2000 Hz), sloping to moderate mixed loss (4000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT: 37 dB HL, WRS: 96% at 70 dB HL. Left SRT: 10 dB HL, WRS: 90% at 60 dB HL. Excellent word recognition bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Not measured due to a history of otosurgery.

proposed_items: Referral to ENT for evaluation of dizziness
Follow-up for amplification if interest develops
counseling_actions: Discussed hearing results showing stable post-surgical status
Explained that dizziness symptoms are consistent with BPPV
Advised on monitoring hearing stability annually

escalation.rationale_short: For evaluation and management of dizziness symptoms (BPPV).

expected_outcome: ENT evaluation revealed symptoms consistent with left BPPV.
Patient continued follow-up with an ENT specialist as recommended.
Annual testing to monitor hearing stability was recommended.
